fields.javadoc:
The program-counter value corresponding to a machine instruction
 generated by the compiler.
fields.name: address
fields.comment:
The program-counter value corresponding to a machine instruction
 generated by the compiler.

fields.javadoc:
An unsigned integer indicating the identity of the source file
 corresponding to a machine instruction.
fields.name: file
fields.comment:
An unsigned integer indicating the identity of the source file
 corresponding to a machine instruction.

fields.javadoc:
An unsigned integer indicating a source line number. Lines are
 numbered beginning at 1. The compiler may emit the value 0 in cases
 where an instruction cannot be attributed to any source line.
fields.name: line
fields.comment:
An unsigned integer indicating a source line number. Lines are
 numbered beginning at 1. The compiler may emit the value 0 in cases
 where an instruction cannot be attributed to any source line.

fields.javadoc:
An unsigned integer indicating a column number within a source line.
 Columns are numbered beginning at 1. The value 0 is reserved to
 indicate that a statement begins at the ??left edge?? of the line.
fields.name: column
fields.comment:
An unsigned integer indicating a column number within a source line.
 Columns are numbered beginning at 1. The value 0 is reserved to
 indicate that a statement begins at the ??left edge?? of the line.

fields.javadoc:
A boolean indicating that the current instruction is the beginning of a
 statement.
fields.name: isStatement
fields.comment:
A boolean indicating that the current instruction is the beginning of a
 statement.

fields.javadoc:
A boolean indicating that the current instruction is the beginning of a
 basic block.
fields.name: isBasicBlock
fields.comment:
A boolean indicating that the current instruction is the beginning of a
 basic block.

fields.javadoc:
A boolean indicating that the current address is that of the first byte after
 the end of a sequence of target machine instructions.
fields.name: isEndSequence
fields.comment:
A boolean indicating that the current address is that of the first byte after
 the end of a sequence of target machine instructions.
